text: Had to have day surgery. Was told to be there for 7, surgery at 9. Right from the get go with the lady in admitting I had a GREAT experience. I've spent time at HSC, The Vic, 7 Oaks and St B (both patient and guest) and never had an experience like yesterday. Mercedes in the surgery day care should get a raise (she talked to the wife and I like we were old friends while doing her job 100%) the anesthesiologist and his student are kind and funny guys. The nurses in pre op who liked my beard and chatted with me are sweethearts.Taylor and Brian in recovery made me feel safe and taken care of. Hell,  even the gentleman who pushed my bed from day care to pre op was always smiling and cheerful. All the way to the lady at the front door (I think a volunteer) who made sure I could use the paid parking machine was great. Anyone who talks bad about the Grace baffles me. Just had a family member have an extended stay there and she talked so highly of the staff. I would definitely prefer the Grace over any other hospital (not saying I want to be in any hospital)
We would like to express our sincere gratitude to the medical staff on the third floor for taking such good care of our mother this week. We are so grateful for your attentiveness and respect.

THE doctors killed my mom and i want to know what she died from and why the doctors wont tell me. I talked to my mom 7 hours before they called and said she was dead and gabe us no explanation. I can't even morn over her death because im so pissed off. I think the Grace hospital is a terrible hospital and the nurses and doctors are terrible and they should be held responsible for their actions. My mom was fine and then she was dead so explain to me what happened and why they are being so hush, hush about it. I will never support this hospital. Shame on the staff

This past week my mother was brought into the Grace hospital with pneumonia at the same time she was checked for COVID and it she was positive.
Even though my mother spent 5 days in the emergency dept our family is grateful and has nothing but respect for all the professionals that attended to her needs ,from the drs to the nurses to the X-ray techs and the aides and those who keep the place sanitized.
Thank you for taking such great care of our mother and making her well
To Dr. Lee and nurse Cassidy thank you for your compassion

Joe

Very good doctors and nurses accompanied me from the beginning and end of the surgery . Everyone was very kind to me and gave me amazing care. Thank you very much, it's a pity that you can only put 5 stars here, I would put all 100 stars!!!

Dr plett,
Is responsible for medical negligence in my case and is also responsible for my remaining disability. Around September 9th 2023 I presented with lower limb paralysis and severe leg numbness as well as a FACIAL palsy. He told me everything was a coincidence and sent me home saying I will be fine. What he missed is it was the onset of GBS( a possibly deadly neurological disease), I was properly diagnosed at HSC a month later and the neurological damage to my body is irreversible because of Jeremy Plett he is responsible for my life will never be the same ever again. This disease is treatable if caught early. Stay away from this doctor

My very elderly mother in law was in Grace hospital due to a heart attack.  She needed help to get to the bathroom. The nurse put her in the bathroom,  then forgot about her!! Are you serious??  MIL pressed the help button over and over and over,  no one came. What kind of hospital is this? Horrible! They can't even look after the elderly! It's a disgrace.

They neglected my grandma's health. She came in with a heart attack and survived. Overnight she pressed her panic button due to being in pain. and according to my grandma's roommate she shared a hospital room with she was told to calm down and locked in a room. No help. No assistance. She then passed that same day. The hospital staff lied to us a few times changing their story with what they wrote in there notes. After we came to get her belongings we noticed the hospital staff removed some of it. Aka stole it. After reading other reviews I can see this isn't the first case of elderly neglect. It's sad so many lives have to be lost before someone does something about this terrible hospital.

When I came in to the ER it said waiting time was 2 and a half hours and there was only 3 people in here, I have now been here 6 hours and still waiting. If you are going to post wait times at least be honest or realistic, I understand high priority gets in first but we need a better system then this! Nothing against the staff just the system

We do have free healthcare but it‚Äôs not the best. I understand that doctors, nurses, and other staffs oversees a lot of patients and are pretty exhausted but it is not that hard to have a little empathy and compassion. The doctor who saw me at Emergency gaslighted me that the concern I was feeling wasn‚Äôt an emergency. Literally told me that while the door was open and other patients or staffs might‚Äôve heard. An ‚Äúemergency‚Äù varies from person to person. What you might not see as an emergency may be an emergency to the patient. I felt embarassed and this is one of the reasons why I‚Äôm too scared to come back to the Emergency. Please do better.
Great experience at Grace Hospital. Had to take my mom there recently with pneumonia. Really awesome nurses and doctors. Thank you for all you do! We could see how tired you are üòî‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§ ‚Ä¶

hands down one of the worst hospitals ive never had the pleasure to experience. 2nd time here in many many years and it seems the staff is just as apathetic and slow. curse the paramedics that brought me here as well and their shitty racist attitudes. must be a systemic issue for this hospital. so much for grace

My dear friend was brought into the grace emergency in serious condition, March17/24 being on her contact list i was notified right away. While I was sitting holding her hand watching the staff looking after my friend with such gentle, compassionate care in the hours left to be with us was so amazing. I seen upfront the amount of work the staff at the hospital have looking after our family members , who knows how many hours or days they have worked in a row. The staff remain professional, calm, pleasant and compassionate. As my friend passed away, her male nurse held me as I sobbed and told me they were there for me if I needed anything. The Staff( doctor, nurses, healthcare aides, etc ) at the Grace Emergency are absolutely amazing. Thank you for the wonderful care of my friend and your compassion towards me.  Darlene McEvoy

I was nervous going into the Grace hospital. The entire staff there are amazing. They put me at ease and treated me with dignity and respect. Thank you to each and everyone of you who made my stay there a positive one

I went to Grace Hospital Emergency with extremely high blood pressure at 8:30 am.   It was a very scary situation.  Process was very smooth.  Was admitted, saw the triage nurse, had EKG and blood work, all within 1 hour.   Triage nurse came to me in the waiting area a second time, roughly 1 hour after being admitted  to re-check my blood pressure.    Was in to see a doctor and home by noon.  It was a very good experience.  The doctor on duty was very caring and comforting.  I cannot say a negative thing about my experience.  The volunteer at the entrance to the Emergency Department was just wonderful.  Absolutely no complaints from me.

I needed the service of the hospital‚Äôs ER yesterday and they were fantastic. I arrived by ambulance at 1 am and they got me on to a bed quickly. The stay took most of the day but I received very good care and all staff were very professional and were caring. I will say that the ER was over full and some people didn‚Äôt need urgent care care but that wasn‚Äôt the reason for my note. The complete staff were working to capacity and giving the very best attention to all patients there. Thank you very much. Jack Kuypers

I came in for kidney stones. It was a long wait. Being from a different Province, i have to say that the staff here is great. My doctor was great. Explained well what procedure they would undertake. My nurse Rikki is absolutely a gem. She is caring, nice and goes beyond her way to explain things in a clear and professional manner. I give the staff here a 5 star rating. I'm extremely glad I came to this hospital and recommend this hospital. The wait times can be long but the staff makes up for it as I was treated like a human being and not just a number like other hospitals I've been to.

Brought my father in law to the emergency room when he had a seizure at 2am. Terrible consideration. Didn‚Äôt provide us with chairs to sit. Didn‚Äôt hook him back up to his monitoring systems after going to the bathroom. The room was dirty, garbage littered on the floor. Supposedly it was also ‚Äúunder construction‚Äù the tools didn‚Äôt work and the ceiling was torn wide open. After some time they removed us from the room and put us in the hallway. We spent 8 hours here with little to no communication from staff. Horrible experience.

The hospital has a huge parking area, one at the front and at the back of the hospital. Plus, you can also park along the streets. Just make sure you check and follow all the street signs.

There's Tim Hortons located inside the hospital and cafeteria for staff and visitors.
Great experience at Grace Hospital. Suddenly I had surgery Really awesome nurses and doctors. Thank you for all you do!

My mother was admitted to Grace Hospital on the second floor. She broke her hip and the staff are amazing doctors and all the nurses nurse, Peter to nurse, Bernie and Lori. I wish I knew everybody‚Äôs name and also the Physio therapist, Tom. they really take their time to talk to the patient and try to listen to their conversations and their stories from the bottom of my heart and my mothers. We are so thankful for all the staff at Grace Hospital. and now that my mother is getting discharged February 2, 2024 she has considered all the nurses and doctors on the second floor all her kids. That‚Äôs how much we have appreciated so much what everybody at the Grace Hospital was so kind and considerate and patient with my mother for all the stuff on the second floor. Thank you so much you will never be forgotten And thank you so much for the Staff on the second floor of Grace Hospital. Trying to speak Portuguese to my mother. You guys are all amazing. You guys deserve so much credit take care. Dela Silva & Adelaide Garcia üíã‚ù§Ô∏èüôè

The triage nurses (one in particular) had no compassion, patients or understanding. She was loud so everyone in the ER could hear. I kindly asked her to tone it down she was greatly offended and talked even louder.
Grace hospital staff have zero understanding what mental health is all about. Not my choice of wanting to be there but had endure a very ugly uncomfortable environment while dealing with my mental health. No appropriate help was provided and no understanding from the doctors. I felt  like I was a huge burden and not taken seriously. Not a hospital that is appropriately equipped to handle anyone in a mental health crisis
And note: the poor elderly being neglected and placed in the hallways with no privacy or dignity. So very sad

My mother in law went in on Monday and got transferred to Selkirk Hospital on Friday
Over that time we had some great nurses on Tuesday it was Nikki Wednesday Ashley and Justin and on Friday another Ashley and a lady from Brandon just fantastic nurses
Doctors on the other hand were not very helpful except for the one on Friday and I unfortunately can‚Äôt remember his name.
Right from the minute we got there until we left most of the nurses were great thank you very much she was there March 18-22 2024
They cut off the wrong, completely healthy leg for Jason Kennedy, just so people know how incompetent how staff is here

Big shout out to the doctor,nurses and staff in emergency. On Jan. 12 evening the staff treated my 97yr. old mother with such great care and respect. They checked her out so good nwe are very thankful to you all. St Boniface hospital 2 weeks earlier  barely even looked at her when she was sent there after her fall and missed the fact that she also had a UTI  which was part of her problems. Thank you  again

Absolute best hospital in Winnipeg. I‚Äôve gone there a few times now to the ER and wait time is reasonable and they take all your concerns seriously. Last night was the most recent and I saw a Dr K Hawyluk (I think), she was blonde and pregnant and the most on hands doctor I‚Äôve ever had couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better more understanding and caring doctor. Had Dr. Friesen in the past when my oxygen was very low and he definitely helped me and made me better within two days. Very very happy with everything the grace has to offer.

Grace hospital should not be emergency, the front staff is like they are at hospital for get together.patients are in pain in front of them, but staff is having funny conversations with each other. That‚Äôs good that they are trying to be happy at their job, but you should see their faces, if you interrupt their conversation and ask a question twice. They are like patients are bothering them.
I had miscarriage at 3 month and was in pain. I asked for a warm blanket, they completely refused. I waited for 10 hours there, when I got my turn, the nurse checked me. I told her that I had miscarriage at home and it‚Äôs 3rd day that I am in severe pain. And I have scan appointment tomorrow at another hospital. She just gave me advil shot and 2 tylenols. She said go to your scan tomorrow, we can‚Äôt do anything here. I waited for 10 hours, only for this advice.  Thats it. I don‚Äôt suggest to go there, if you are unfortunately facing this kind of situation.
Next day, I went seven oaks hospital, my ultrasound showed, I still have tissues, so I again waited there 5 more hours in pain to see a doctor .At that time I felt like I did mistake that I became pregnant. Because I didn‚Äôt get any help that I needed. But doctor at Seven oaks realized that I am going back and forth to different hospitals, he quickly made my appointment for D&C procedure.
What kind of emergency is this?

The staff is really friendly if nothing else but God help you if you need to use the rest room and aren't hooked up to a catheter. I needed my IV unhooked so as to walk to a toilet and waited two and a half hours for that to happen. The nurses don't answer the call button, that only brings a guy who can't do a thing but bring you a jug to urinate in or a cup of water if you're lucky, but he can also get the nurse for you unless his shift ending or break are just around the corner, then you can just go screw. Wait times are worse than Seven Oaks, during the day even with a less than full waiting room and I hate it so much I'd almost rather suffer at home than come here for treatment. I was given so much of a drug that was only meant to relax me before an endoscopy that I lost consciousness and woke up back up in my room not knowing what hospital I was at. One in five are so bad at administering IV's that I felt like I could do it better.  I was "scheduled" for a procedure (the endoscopy) only to find out later to find out they can't schedule this because transport (it would be faster to walk but this isn't an option) just gets there when they get there so don't hold your breath. I would almost, ALMOST go back if I were dying but Seven Oaks is closer to where I live and even a late night skeleton crew moves faster.

I had cut my finger with a circular saw. When we got to the hospital I looked like there might be more happening to me medically, than just the finger, so my wife took me to Emergency as opposed to Access. Emergency people checked me out, wrapped my finger. Told us that Access would be able to stitch the finger with less wait time than the Emergency area. Great care in the Emergency area, in a timely fashion!!  Stitches were done on Access.

a terrible hospital to wait 8 hours to be scalped alive with a scalpel, no drainage or hospitalization, the doctor or whoever she is or the nurse is a jerk, no sympathy, nothing, it is more important for her to write a prescription just so that Lyulina drank an antibiotic for more than a month, but you can not take pills for epilepsy to drink, that's why I put 0 stars, but you can't do that here, I don't recommend this hospital ,that's why I don't believe that people write good reviews here, it's the hospital itself, it creates accounts that are great.  It's terrible to squeeze out pus, I've never seen it before, this doctor or whoever she is or a nurse had no right to squeeze out, they usually put a drain.

Was at Grace hospital today.
All the staff (Nurses, Doctors, Healthcare assistants, security guards) were so nice and kind with so much empathy for patients at the EI, plus excellent bed ‚Ä¶

The nurses were so reassuring and calming.  The Dr was great and helped me with my issue.  I had to travel over 7 hours to find an answer the Northen Health Region couldn't give me.  So far my issue is starting resolve but not completely yet.  Still working on my issue.  Check in clerk was absolutely reassuring as well and gave me pointers and I really appreciated it.  One of the Nurses I recognized that was a community member from my home town and it was so nice to see her succeed and not be stuck in our small home town where we have little to no jobs.  Way to go!

The wait in the emergency room is unbelievable after 6 to 8 hrs then you will be seen. Well for non extreme pain is ok like my husband, the dr and nurses treated him very well! Unfortunately for my daughter she was in so much pain and I tried to go this guy who was on the other end of the reception checking blood pressure and all, he was extremely rude and did not even care. When I told him my daughter was in so much pain and sitting on the floor of the toilet and also vomiting, and if there was anything to be done just to ease the pain, his replied was! well you have to wait and go back to your seat with his dirty look. Very rude emergency office staff are not trained well for their job. Unprofessional! But the good thing was the Dr and the Nurses were so kind enough to say sorry for the long wait when they found out how much pain she had because of the inflamed appendix. This kind of treatment by uneducated, unprofessional who doesn't serve the community well!  working in the emergency, reception and front desk needs to be inspected very well as this is their first impression on how they show empathy to people who need help in time of pain. Pathetic service.
This is the best hospital. I was dying with abnormal pain but they saved my life. I am really thankfull to whole staff.
Went here for practicum , was awful.  Third floor south. I barely started and after just 2 days, they told me to leave because I was a slow learner . Such a shame of these people

I spent 5 days in Grace Hospital with emergency surgery just before Christmas. As a former health care worker for 30 yrs in the city's 2nd largest hospital, this hospital was amazing. I  left my job because of poor management and extremely unhappy people.  Every person that cared for me during my stay was so kind. From the busy nurses in Emergency to the ones on the ward. Everyone was smiling and happy. Thank you all for making an unpleasant time bearable. 4 South  huge kudos xx

If your tense about MRI's don't be the staff in the imaging dept. Are exceptional!! I use to take drugs before I went and now I don't. They put a cool cloth over your eyes that helps you relax and will ask you several times if your doing ok. You feel so relaxed don't be
Surprised if you fall asleep!!+ I AM NOT KIDDING!!! Now if I have to get an MRI I ALWAYS ASK FOR GRACE HOSPITAL.
I get here for the second time. Always attentive and caring staff. Thank you for your work!

Could be worse. Could be be better. Really depends who you see. Only got the care I needed because the NP I saw at access west made them check for blood clots. Everyone is very nice and professional though.

Went to Er to have then l√≤ok at a cast that was put on the week before on my arm and wrist. This was because cast was tight and arm and hand were hot. Immediately the
Male nurse cut the cast off and I waited for New one to be put on. Was a 10 hour wait and that was fine. Others needed  care. I had a new one on and then they had to try and and cut off a titanium ring. Very difficult for them. They got it off with a grinder. They were very careful and patience..I want to say thank you so much for the care and kindness  that was given me. Even though I was there for 12 hours I was happy to see sick people go before. Yes, all doctors were very busy as well as nurses.. koodos  to all. And thank you Barbara Mager

I was there jan 6 at emergency it was very efficient  all the staff was wonderful.  I was there about  4 hours had x-rays.  If you have something serious there is not much of a wait.  Do  not go to emergency  for minor things go to access they treat you very well and Lot faster

We needbto be better!! Okay so i have to make a post about The GRACE HOSPITAL and its employees, which is tough to do atm because of this Pneumonia...but, I am disgusted in what I saw there today and how these healthcare "professionals" treated members from our community seeking care for medical concerns. They weren't as bad when speaking to me, but i witnessed this condecending, rude, inhumane treatment towards the majority of patients in the waiting room, who were nothing but polite to staff just to have the Grace Hospital employees speak to them so loudly, rude with an attitude that was to make people know that they are "better" than you, and then turn around and snicker and make jokes about the patients, which I also heard them do behind closed doors when I was finally being seen after 10 hours of waiting. People were cut down to size for simply asking a question. I saw zero communication skills from the staff members in the emergency room. Shame on them. If you know someone who was working in the ER room today/tonight tell them "shame on your co-workers and I hope you weren't a part of this." I have never witnessed such unprofessionalism at this level in a hospital in my entire life. If i have the strength tomorrow i may try and find out the best way for file a complaint is on behalf of the entire waiting room. People gotta be better than this, gotta be better...

I don‚Äôt know who to blame government healthcare department but this system is so evil people are dying with pian wait time in emergency is extremely high for god sake please do something about it may god save us from this evil place waited ‚Ä¶

I went to Emergency at Grace Hospital and was treated with kindness and professionalism from every person that helped me - the people that gave me a mask, the woman that registered me, triage, the nurse practitioner (Kate, you‚Äôre amazing!), the doctor, and lastly the woman that performed my ultrasound. Yes, it was a lengthy wait and a long day but that‚Äôs the system.
Thank you for all that you do and the compassion that you show.

I felt so unwelcome here
Wasn‚Äôt ‚Äòt allowed to get water for my husband who was a patient.
There were no restrictions put in place by the doctor, the nurses just barred access to the water cooler and the ice machine.
When aides came todo something they would tell me to leave because it was too crowded
Really rude and made me cry everyday I was there.  HUsband was left in a dirty diaper and developed sores and a rash. I know we don‚Äôt get a choice here in Manitoba, but avoid the grace if you can

Amazing care received from nurses and doctors and orderlys in emergency. Thank you Nurse Karen and pharmacist Heather for all your patience. Even the cleaning lady was kind and helpful.
The only negative was the 5 hr wait to be seen. Par for the course these days, I guess.

Stay away from this hospital if you can.

I'm disgusted this is the healthcare we Canadians are receiving. They abuse/ neglect the elderly that have to stay overnight.

I understand we have a giant issue with our healthcare system, but staff that laugh and mock patients, neglecting the elderly, lying to cover their own skin when reports are made against them. Yeah no.

I wish I could rate a 0 star.

I was surprised at so many critical reviews, primarily of treatment by staff. I had Covid and was brought to the hospital by EMS - Ambulance Transport. I was wheeled in and parked in a corridor. The Paramedic kept me informed that they were searching for a bed. A female staff member asked me for my medical coverage cards. Copied and returned. That was the only contact entering and leaving that dealt with payment. As an American, I was amazed. Paperwork is the name of American medical service.
I did receive a bill today, already paid the EMS bill several weeks ago. I did end up in an emergency room bed, sharing the space with an elderly lady. The staff were excellent as was the treatment. My only complaint, minor really, was that the bill requires calling and requesting to pay.
Seems strange to me that their system is not more user friendly, .i.e., on-line credit card payment. Love the Canadians.

I do not always take the time to do a review but felt this was very necessary.
I currently had knee replacement surgery at the Grace Hospital and would like to thank the many amazing and beautiful staff members that took such good care of me.
To my surgeon Dr. Ames, nurses, Physiotherapist and the aides, I was very blessed to be under their care.
The kindness and professionalism that was shown was second to none.
We should be very proud of our health system and take the time to give thanks for what they all do especially in this very difficult time.
I am truly grateful to each of for all that you had done while I was in recovery.
May you be safe and protected as you serve as you do.

Took my baby there yesterday, she isn't even two years old! Wanted to get her checked for a fever.... they wouldn't even look at her nothing just kept saying the nurse won't see your child because of her fever and kept going on about a CT scan.... didn't know you needed one for a fever.... that's a new one on me! I just needed my child to be looked at....

but I went to another clinic up the street and my child was good and no fever and her eyes, nose, ears, throat and chest were good and clear! :) they didn't even understand why my child was not looked at, at the grace and gave me a number to call to report it!

Because the nurses and doctors at the other place were shocked they denied a BABY! and even the doctor who did see us said he's the one who has to refer us to children's if she needed to go there and was actually happy I went to the walk in because I wasn't wasting others importance at the real hospital for a fever! That's why we have walk ins! ...

But I'm going to push it with the doctors and nurses at the grace now..... my poor child all because they were probably wanting to get off early! I hope you were so full after I left!

I‚Äôm glad I went to this ER because the wait was shorter. I ended up needing emergency surgery. I am super happy with the care I received. All the staff I encountered were very nice and caring. Thank you for the hard work you all do, especially in the current state of our healthcare.

Chelsea was above and beyond. I was there for my kidney stones. I was in pain, she was very kind was checking up on me every hour not only me but every other patient as well.
I went to emergency room for my pain, she really helped me through out all the process and have genuine advise to me what to do next.

In for Hip Replacement. From the first moment I walked In till I was wheeled out, I was treated with kindnes and total respect
From the Security Guard, all the Nurses, and Doctor Ames and his Surgical Team. Thank you everyone for the great job.üò∑üò∑ ‚Ä¶

Why employ self-glorified receptionists if they can't be bothered with to do their jobs and answer the phone?!? Namely nuclear medicine. I have been calling all morning and NOT ONCE, did they answer the phone!! What are they doing? Socializing, having numerous breaks and having fun at the tax payers expense?!?

I want to thank all the staff in the emergency department. I was in there from Sunday until Tuesday and they were all fantastic. Even though it was extremely busy and the nurses are so short staffed they treated me like I truly mattered. I also want to thank my ambulance guys, Bill and Mathew ( sorry if my spelling is wrong) for treating me with such care.

My husband spent time in this hospital (lac of) well because you call this a hospital.  This place is filthy (I have pictures to prove), the patient rooms are not cleaned, my husband was moved from aria in emergency to another with out cleaning it but they wouldn't let me see him because I would spread germs.  The care he received was not care at all but just a bed to lay in with the hope he would die.  Dr. Macek should not be aloud to practice medicine on  a stuffed animal let alone a person.  Dr Macek was my husband‚Äôs Dr while in hospital.  He has got the worse Dr ever.  When asked about my husband care all he would say what do you want me to do, then I asked him if he was just waiting for him to die, he stated that is all he is doing, then I stated I wanted to transfer my husband out of that hospital he gave for and answer I wish you would. When I asked him for a list of all the meds my husband was on, he was very condescending and stated "I don't know what you want it for you won‚Äôt know what to do with it.  They sent my husband home while in raspatory.  So anyone out there reading this please don't bring your loved one to this place unless you want them to die.  THIS HOSPITAL SHOULD BE CLOSED NEVER TO BE REOPEN AGAIN.

I love this hospital,
I really wish to work with their team.

Emergency department was quick to get me in. Short wait time and very thorough. The staff were super friendly and helpful! The doctors were very knowledgeable and did a great job with my surgery! I was very pleased with the overall quality of my stay here! Special thanks to my nurse, Candace, and student nurse, Amber, who kept me as comfortable as possible! Hope I don't have to go back to a hospital any time soon, but if I do, it'll be Grace!

Suddenly, my body stopped to accept any foods even water. I lost 22 pounds for 2 weeks. I had pain on the stomach so I went to Grace hospital emergency. Doctors, nurses, staffs are professional. The waiting time was the same as I checked on web site. Doctors are very knowledgeable and skillful. They found my sickness that I've been suffering over 10 years! I was transfered to another hospital for treatments quickly.
I highly recommend Grace hospital.

I had to wait a few hours in ER for my cat scan but the environment was clean and quiet, and the nursing staff were courteous and efficient. The doctor whom I finally saw was similarly kind and very professional. I was very impressed with the whole experience at the Grace.

Unfortunately, my dad was in the hospital for 23 days, on the 21st day we got a call from a nurse, not the doctor, updating us. We requested a call 20 of those 23 days. At time 2 to 3 times in a day we requested a call, they had no intention of telling us what was happening to him, they sent him home for a second time with the wrong medication. This is borderline malpractice from this place. When visiting, conveniently the nurse or doctor in charge of him was "unavailable". Absolutely unacceptable...

No other hospital in Winnipeg has ignored pleas from a family to get ANY kind of information.
I can not thank the staff at Grace Hospital enough for looking after me  during my hip replacement recovery.  To the doctors, nurses and full staff, thanks for everything.   You are truly the best.

I understand nurses are overworked, but when someone comes in for an emergency....then they should atleast be treated with respect.  Speaking gruffly to sick patients doesn't help anyone. I will not be going to this ER in the future, but the way they treat patients, they probably won't much care. Very sad state   a little compassion and patience goes a long way .

My mom went to Grace beginning of October for a fractured femur. She got her surgery quickly. And the staff, nurses and doctors were amazing everytime I called which was often as I live out of Winnipeg.  Can't say enjoy positive things about the grace!!!

I gave 5 stars beacuse there are so many hard working staff that literally saved my life. It only takes one person to have a bad experience. I came in with DKA (as many know DKA affects cognitive function) my memories from sitting in the waiting room in the ER are a little vague but I remember laying on the floor. I was vomiting and it had taken me to long already to get to the ER. Once I got in to see a doctor he commented I shouldn't have been in the waiting room for over 4 hours. Leaving me sitting in a waiting room for 4 hours when triage knew I had very high blood sugar likely pushed me deeper into DKA and literally could have pushed me into a diabetic coma or even death. I believe there triage process should be improved.

The staff are unbelievably rude and treat all the patients with complete disrespect in highly disgusting ways to watch.
I went in for heart problems, my EKG and blood work was fine, and the doctor discharged me without any discussion and told me to see a doctor the next day... After waiting 8 hours in pain.

To make things worse, the construction makes many areas not wheelchair accessible, and I watched people for hours get refused a room because they could not walk. You know, at a hospital...

They also are using the emergency lobby as an entry/exit for patients on gurney's/coding/etc.

It's sure great that the shut down of the other emergency hospitals somehow caused this one to turn horrible also. This is your tax dollars at work... or, more accurately, the lack of tax funding in our health care, even after everything that's gone on these past few years...

They lost my mother-in-law!!! We received a call from Grace Hospital telling us that she was going to be discharged, at midnight!!! She‚Äôs over 75 years old, and needs an interpreter. We drove there to pick her up and they told us that she was picked up already!!! By who!!! We called the medical services they said they supposedly called, they never heard of her or received any call from Grace Hospital. They kept trying to convince us that she got picked up, very arrogant and condescending. After over an hour of frantically trying to find her, someone escorted me inside and we found her still there. This was very emotionally draining!!! They even tried telling us that she was transferred to Misericordia hospital, they never heard of her there too.

Came here after waiting Over an hour in a disgusting outdated waiting room at the Miseracordia. I was shocked at how clean these facilities were and more importantly how incredible the staff were. Their bedside manor was top notch. We were treated with respect and compassion and I feel very grateful for the staff here. I wish I could do more to thank them other then leave this review. The nurses were attentive and genuinely concerned. Great people with big hearts.

I was admitted into the hospital in an emergency basis. First they did not provide me any treatment instead of it they inserted needles in my body which was of no use. My whole arm is now swollen. I can't lift my arm a lil bit too. There is an injury in my finger which i got from there.The staff there is not at all cooperative. I was screaming since i was admitted in the hospital for a glass of water. But they did not provide me a drop of water till i was discharged from the hospital. Overall my experience was worst. The staff and doctors just look at their own convenience. They do not listen to what the patient is saying or through which the patient is going. If there will be an option of zero star giving, i  would love to do that

The waiting room is gross, always has litter. The bathroom in the waiting room was covered in blood. The front desk nurses are either incredibly sweet (shout out to these amazing ladies) while others couldn't care less about getting off their a**es to bring me a puke bucket... and the doctor who basically treated me like i waisted his time today. Been here on more than one occasion (because its the closest to my home) and it's always awful. You get one star because of the amazing nurses that are PROBABLY holding the entire place together.

I broke my elbow in March of this year 2021 and received immediate care,with an X-ray and seeing the surgeon and having a cast on I was out of there in a hour and a half and on my way home I had excellent service staff were friendly and very helpful. I also broke my left hip and fractured my femur I had been brought there by ambulance from the Victoria hospital had surgery immediately. I was there for a month and had excellent care so I thank you for the excellent care for the two times I had been there I was taken back to the Victoria for another month of rehab from both hospitals I could not have been better looked after

Dr. Smith was very caring and thoughtful with taking care of my ‚ÄúWasband‚Äù. My problem was with the nurse scolding me for taking him to Emergency when she thought that I should have gone thru his family physician. The triage nurse also didn‚Äôt agree with our choice to go to the Emergency Room when I thought he was having mini strokes‚Ä¶. This was Friday May 13‚Ä¶ triage in the morning with a male nurse and the scolding nurse was a young female. As it turned out he may have a brain bleed and has blocked arteries in his neck. I may not be a trained in medicine but I know when something is wrong. Lucky I stuck to my guns and didn‚Äôt leave.

Mediocre service. Not the best and not the worst. Disappointed by ultrasound department. Not only missed my vein, but didn‚Äôt do test with dye! Needed to wait months to be reschedule elsewhere. Confused by this because the guy who does it during days has been efficient in the past, but not this time. Hoping department manager can oversee this going forward. People's health are at stake here and mistakes aren‚Äôt acceptable.

Truly disgusted by lack of empathy and care in emergency waiting room. Nurses seem to revel in their ability to ignore patience and say it‚Äôs due to covid policy.  I pray that my loved one will be ok. Prayer seems to be only option as this bastion of modern science is leaving her alone for hours and hours with no food no water no visitors and no help, despite her being very ill.

I would leave zero stars if possible. I went to the emergency room with extreme difficulty breathing. I was told to wait and they wanted to get my info before they would even provide me with oxygen so I could breathe. The overnight triage nurse was the rudest nurse I have ever encountered. I explained to her that I suffer from panic disorder and was hyperventilating from a panic attack. ...she told me to "calm down".

Dealing with abrain injury and i waited over 12 hours.  No one paid attention to me. after 9 hours they took my vitals.  Secruirty guards half asleep nurses were rarely around. Patients screaming help for 30 mins straight no one even goes near.

The staff were fantastic. Keep in mind that with all the emergency rooms around Winnipeg being shut down if you require urgent care,go to an urgent care facility. Five stars wpildnhave appendix removed again. 8 hours from arrival  to going under the knife.

For Dr. Caroline Scott-
My mother was admitted last week into Scarborough Grace hospital for ‚Äúminexes‚Äù tear in the back of her knee. Initially the hospital wanted to discharge her despite her pain. Then a doctor in the ER called Dr. Scott and she accepted to see my moms knee. Long story short she was kept there and Dr. Scott operated in my mom last night out of humanity, compassion and care. She is phenomenal, a true example of a physician who cares for patients in need. She also has a great assistant, Arthy, who is super kind as well. Thank you Dr. Scott and Arthy for collaborating and pushing through for my mother.

I felt extremely let down by our healthcare system because of my experience at this hospital. I was turned away because my condition wasn't deemed urgent enough when in fact it was urgent to me. There were others with sniffles and sprained ankles that were being admitted.

Was rushed to Grace on Aug 3. I'm from Toronto. Was all alone at Grace.

Had to have emergency appendicitis surgery.

The staff were great. They were caring, professional.

They made me feel relaxed. Being that i was alone.

I was impressed by the service, the staff, the hospital stay.

Thank you Grace emergency department, OR team, CT scan team, nurses on 4th.

Thank you. Thank you. You guys are amazing. Thank you.
the ER wait times are atrocious and deserves 1/5 stars based on that. But the care you receive here deserves 5/5 stars and the workers are amazing.

I am ashamed of The Grace Endoscopy dept.
My son went there for a second opinion and what a huge difference from Selkirk General to Grace ..the male HCA  had him up and walking with 20 of his double procedure ..my son went in at 8:30 and we were called foe pick up at 8:56üò≥yikes he did t even help him the washroom and my son was quiet out of it ..puked all the home we had to keep stopping for him to get sick..wow Grace  Hosp..Bing bang bong make that $$$ wow disgusting  care you should be ashamed HCA in that department

If I could give zero stars I would. I went to the ER March 18, 2021 around 5am. I have irritable bowel disease and every now and then I get a terrible flare up. I was in extreme pain such induced vomiting. I was worried I had a bowel obstruction. Little to no empathy or care was shown by any of the nurses. When I arrived there was no one else in the waiting room. I was hysterical, crying due to pain, hard time breathing, vomiting. Last time this happened I was given an IV with fluids, a pink lady concoction and buscopan almoat immediately. I sat in pain crying and vomiting for about 1 hour when the triage nurse finally triaged me. She told me to calm down and sit up straight or she wouldn't be able to get my vitals. Im like lady I am in extreme pain, if I could make this stop I would. I told her that last time this happened I was given a medicine called pink lady and it helped with the pain.. She was all snooty and said pink lady is to freeze the esophagus not for bowels. I said well last time it helped my digestive system almost immediately. Her level of care or empathy was terrible. I had fallen on the floor and one other nurse brought me a wheel chair because my pain was so terrible. This triage nurse didn't offer to wheel me back to the waiting room or when she called my name I had to wheel myself over. I will never go back to this hospital for an emergency. Being from a different province I am shocked by the level of care at the Grace Hospital. When we moved here my neighbor said the Grace Hospital is where people fo to die and to avoid it at all cost. Most places would have me in for an x-ray ultrasound or CT scan ASAP to avoid a bowel rupture and determine the cause of pain. Luckily my husband was able to find my prescription for buscopan and came to pick me up after I waited almost 2 hours in excruciating pain. I always feel better laying down and there was no place to lay down at the hospital. I went home and when my bowels ever flare up again I will NEVER go back here. Next time I might not be so lucky and may end up septic with a bowel rupture and either die or have to have emergency surgery and a poop bag. Stay clear of this place if you can.

Spent 3 days at the grace after my second total knee replacement surgery. As in my first experience with my previous knee replacement, the staff at the grace were wonderful in all respects. I have nothing but good things to say about this hospital and its staff.

Surgeons did a great job with my first ever surgery under general annistesha. They explained everything to me in a very clear manner. They are also kind and friendly. All of the staff was great,
they were helpful and  patient.

I was at this place just 10 mins ago. I came to see my 8 months old niece, she got a really high fever.
So we came to see her. But the two girls who worked at that ship at emegency section ( Friday night, July17) they talked to us like yelling at us, we felt like there were discrimination. While they only needed an explanation that we couldn‚Äôt come because there can be only one get in with the patient.
We understand the rule, but i was just super mad because of their attitude. Super super rude.
And while we came, they were talking, joking, playing laptop and texting,.... i can see how unprofessional and non- respectful.

A couple years ago I brought my uncle to this hospital to have kidney stones removed. He has dementia, and the surgery left him in a state of heightened confusion. The nurse who ran the ward that my uncle stayed on acted so incredibly inconvenienced whenever he needed anything. It was disgusting.

Today I brought my brother to the emergency room because he was experiencing INTERNAL BLEEDING. The doctor he saw called him a LIAR and REFUSED to investigate. He sent my brother home.

Bring your loved ones to this hospital if you want them to be neglected. The name is a complete farce.

Awesome being there, very very well looked after and cared for, very professional great staff, food was great too.. best quiche I've ever had ( how did they do that?? and my roomie agreed, were hoping could stay longer just for the food! ), really can't say enough good things, real pro's, personable and friendly too (yes, even some friendly fun was had).    Well done and my hearty thanks to everyone there.

If I hadnt called a doctor that I know telling him of my condition and him insisting on me finding a ride to the hospital to see him , i would have never gone there
They confirmed what I already knew when my sister died there 2 years ago. Although i only waited 4 hours in pain and with a roaring fever, once they brought me inside emergency all hell broke loose. Insensitive doesnt come close to describe the nurses. And unfortunately because I am without family I had to bring my kids. They put us in the room meant for criminals. Cuff bars in the walls and a stretcher. Literally the ONLY things in the room. They wouldnt even get me a warm blanket or pillow. The kids grew anxious and so did I. So they moved me to a TV room in the hall!! No bed, nothing to lay on. A chair. I was happy for my kids but I was still suffering. The nurses were awful. They jabbed my arm with the IV and were not ar all sensitive of my fear of needles. They were short with me and made empty promises of food and water which I finally recieved after 11 hours. They nurse that discharged me was very kind. Ironic as I'm on my way out the door.
Dont go there. I gave it one star because the dr I had originally called continually checked on me and made requests on my behalf. It is unfortunate he wasnt able to treat me because of some new computer system they have. But he did his best.

I was driving from Bc to Qc when I started to have symptoms of appendicitis. I looked at some google reviews when I was in Brandon Mb, and decided to drive two more hours to get to Grace Hospital. Best decision ever made! Even though an appendectomy is not remotely close from enjoyable, the entirety of the medical team was nice, polite, competent and very patient oriented. I got in ER at 8am on a Sunday. Went through a bunch of tests (blood, scan, urine, etc.), received the diagnostic, then a surgery at 6pm and was allowed to leave 24 hours after. Thanks again for everything!!!

I could have died or lost my kidney function last visit if I couldnt have spelled out that it would end badly and very publicly if that happened.
Your Marfans syndrome expert spelled out pretty well what I've known all along was likely the case.

Im getting all the research done that I said I would. Keep playing games. If I die, its all being disseminated for you to answer to. Spelled out with aching questions that I never had the chance to see answered by a Court.
Getting drunk and whining about it amongst your brethren isn't going to make the difference you've grown accustomed to.üòä

Cannot describe how horrible the Emergency is/was when we had to take my Father in last week.  Sloppy service, insensitive staff, long waiting for a possibly dying man.  Was told I was being confrontational when I asked for assistance and received none.  Totally different story once he was moved to the 3rd floor wards; extremely caring, friendly and doing their very best to help.

Went into the Grace this week end and was well treated . I realize there is always a wait period and it was not that long . I think it is suppose to work who ever is the sickest goes first . Pretty sure with me throwing up and to tired to walk, high blood pressure soaring and high  blood sugar  I was chosen for my condition . Thanks to all the staff at the grace for every thing they do ! From my family to yours

broke my ankle walking on ice like a champ saturday morning. waited a lot, which i expected; i mean, im 22, all ive got is a broken ankle, i can wait. the nurses were all lovely, the er doctors were great, and they managed to get me in for surgery way quicker than i expected!! everything went smoothly, and everyone working up in the recovery ward was wonderful too. thanks everybody, im recovering well at home ü§üü§ü
16 hours of waiting to see the doctor with acute abdominal pain ‚Ä¶.

Had to take my mom there for a breathing problem, no one was in the waiting room, proceeded to get yelled at by a nurse there for no reason and THREE HOURS LATER walked out and went some where else because all we did was sit there, the doctors and nurses were gossiping and making FUN of other PATIENTS!!! While my mom couldn‚Äôt breath, HIGHLY UNPROFESSIONAL and I beg you that if u need help, don‚Äôt go to the grace hospital.

Big thank you to Dawn McDonald, she was able to find the missing items a family member was brought into the hospital with. I would like to thank her for being professional caring and able to solve our issue, and of course being able to courier the belongings to our front door.

Worst experience, after going here with symptoms of appendicitis and waiting three hours in the waiting room with them putting symptomatic people in waiting room. four hours waiting for a CT scan that they messed up on sending to the CT staff. Not giving any pain reliever or a blanket. Also ignoring my IV machine malfunctioning. If you have a choice to go to another hospital ,go to another hospital.

Horrible service. Sister in law has been here battling cancer and when her brother called looking for her they said she's not there and hung up. We called back and told them she's a cancer patient and has been there for quite some time and they did the same exact same thing.

my son has been brought by ambulance to Grace Emerg 6 times in past year 1 1/2  as recent as Oct 25/17. Doctor's and nurses have been wonderful, caring - I thank the Lord for the paramedics , fire men , Dr'sand nurses that  have all treated him and myself with respect and dignity.

HOW IN THE WORLD can this hospital be rated highly is BEYOND me and many!! Husband brought there by ambulance with chest pains nausea and extremely high blood pressure ... released same day after what they call "stabilization!!!" without any investigation other than blood work and EKGs. The latter were abnormal!! With a family history of heart related issues!! If we were in Ontario we would have had nuclear heart test right away to check for any blockages. Also would not have been released to street without being given blood pressure pills (which has had for awhile!) !!! WORSE than any place Ive lived!!! NICE PEOPLE ...but terribly BAD decision making and treatment!! RN friends are SHOCKED by this too. IF ANYTHING happens to him ... they are RESPONSIBLE. In such cases you CANNOT release a person ... YOU MUST do nuclear test!!!

I was just at the hospital yesterday and got out this afternoon, all I can say it is a class hospital, and the staff are very polite even during this struggle with the Covid, they look after your really well when needed but they are definitely short staffed. What I can‚Äôt believe is how many nurses and doctors are working double shifts, some are working 16 hour shifts. Stay Safe and Strong Frontline workers

Absolute horrible care. My father in law is once again discharged '2nd time' without homecare set up. Nor any confirmation -2 days now n pending! My father in law lives on his own (personal care home pending) has had 4 strokes in the past, has Diabetes t2, HTN, obese, could not do any ADLs (activity daily living) for himself and they do the same discharge style on to him once again this second time around! First admit was due to stroke- He called us in the middle of the night to call an ambulance for him- admit to Grace x1-
They promised homecare setup post discharge yet it took them a whole month until XMAS day - that he crashed in our house during dinner!

He was then rushed via ambulance to Grace hospital once again- this 2nd time was due to -as diagnosed, cellulitis! (Hence no one was around i.e. homecare- to watch over him for a whole month!).

I work as an RN in er emerg at HSC and I've seen seen the 'horrible- nurse family complainer' once in a while in my 10 year experience. I hate having to deal with them im sorry- but this im worrisome with GH's decision for discharge! Hence we were patient with the 'whole month' that home care off of Grace Hospital did not get back to my father in law- we were 'understanding' with their MIX UP. BUT this second time without one setup boggles my mind! I have filed a complaint with patient relations and WRHA. I hope someone gets stuff straight and DO NOT WISH THIS onto anyone of your loved ones to happen to them- VERY UNSAFE diacharge

I apologise to 'those who ARE NOT INVOLVED' ... My father in law was discharged from the 3rd floor ?north wing Grace hospital february 7th at 240pm. NO home care contact yet n counting. Its hard to attend to someone i.e. 5am call from him today that his Foley catheter bag leaked all over his bed and he is confused out of his mind trying to explain it to my flustered husband.

I visited my father for 10+ hours per day for two weeks while my father was in acute care for five weeks here in 2015. Staff were extremely caring and professional despite being surrounded by patients who are sick, dying or with dementia. Doctors are very busy and can be hard to see but they always made time to answer our questions. Surprisingly, my father's family doctor is across the street, however incompatible computer systems kept them from exchanging X-ray info. Visitors can help by being empathetic and sensitive to others. Friendly Manitoba is easy to experience with so many people eager to chat and joke around the campus.

My family will all attest that the large cafeteria is quite good with $2 healthy soups and lunch specials that are hard to beat for value.

Came here, had 3 nurses miss my veins.
Keep in mind, I‚Äôve never had anyone miss my vein before I have normal veins.
Just kind of annoying. As I was waiting for the third nurse the lady beside me told me her niece had the same problem here with the nurses being not totally trained on finding veins.
Keep in mind before you go here, HSC is the best.

Worst hospital I have ever been to! For starters the staff is super mean and I don‚Äôt think they actually care about a persons well being.I had severe back pain and all they did was give some T3‚Äôs and tell me to wait?! I described the pain as a 10/10 but that didn‚Äôt seem to matter for the doctors only there for a pay check. Also the chairs and everything in the ER never get sanitized.

The Doctor was excellent but the rest of the staff was so unprofessional. Its almost like they were new...made so many trips and came back with nothing

The kicker was when the nurse was about to give my pain medication but decided to take a phone while she had the syringe in her hands

I think the patient in pain should be priority
Tge person on the phone can wait

I really like Grace Hospital. It's a very bright and clean environment.
I was in for knee replacement surgery and the entire nursing staff who cared for me were amazing!
Thank you all,  so very much, Kim Mathews

Unprofessional and disrespectful.
The two girls at front door of emergency section on Friday night, July 17th.
They are talking, laughing, texting phones and laptop. The way they talk to us like they yell at us and want to kick us out.
Should hire someone else who can treat people better.
We paid the money for healthcare systems, for not to be treated like this when we come. And not to pay for those workers who treat people like that.

Worst service ever. Made us to wait for 4.5 hours to listen that you have to wait more. It will be great if the staff stop socializing with each other and focus on talking with patients. Please do consider sense of treatment urgency of your patients.

I was a patient here in January 2020 as I had a heart attack. I was miffed because I had some issues they said they would look into but that didn't happen because I was kicked out before they could be addressed. I felt still weak when they discharged me and I didn't feel ready to go home. I never want to be a patient here again.

Incompetent doctors, wasted our time we waited 6hrs to see a doctor just to say we needed more test done which they never recommended. In my country if a person is in the ER the doctor should do whatever it takes to diagnose the condition but here their worried about the $ the Govt will be spending on their high tech machines. If I coule give no stars on this rating will do it!

Great staff at this hospital. Especially CASSIE the nurse at triage.
She is very kind, caring and takes pride in her work.
The waits at this hospital are long but the doctors and nurses are excellent.

I have been there numerous times over the years with family members it is by far the worst emergency room in the city . The staff are to use to working slow and other day when I was there did absoultly nothing to assess the situation and try to provide temporary relief. After asking how long the wait was they gave me usual response "at least one hour". My response was it not one hour its usually 8 hours or more at which time I took my grandson home and dealt with the situation myself. That's pretty bad when I have to do what they are getting paid for to provide the temporary relief. This the second time in aprox last couple of years that we have been there and left .The last time we were there in excess of 8 hours and left.

Just had a medical emergency last night. What was probably the most devastating experience that happened to me was met with the utmost professionalism and kindness by the nurses that assisted me. They really are a super caring group of people and very attentive. Thank you all so much!
I had an MRI completed on saturday feb 20, 2022. the technician Annette was professional, respectful and considerate and did a great job. she is an asset to her dept. and the hosp.
the doctor is good and treat patient nicely but rest of the staff has so much ego and the wait time in emergency room is very long they take around 4-6 hours in emergency room disgusting

Horrendous staff. Did not care about our problems and just had nothing but attitude problems. I get it is a high stress environment, but when dealing with life and death for some, have a little empathy. Will never go there again. Especially if my life depended on it.
Good services, workers, and volunteers are very respectful and helpful. The top hospital in the city!

10 out of 10. Amazing hospital from ER to when you are discharged.  The whole team from doctors nurses
Health care aides to cleaning staff. Superb üíêüëç‚ù§Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏èHad major surgery and I am here to testify of the fact of the awesome care I received ‚Ä¶
0 stars if I could. 8+ hours of waiting to get nothing done.
Went in to ER with a swollen leg could hardly walk and in extreme pain.Triage nurse basically denied me care and said I should go to a walk in.Not impressed

Husband has been in there since early this morning for a procedure.  He is still waiting.  It is 8:03 right now. Is this how things are done in hospitals. He has been fasting since last night.  This is terrible.
Went for total hip replacement last week,great overall experience all the staff right from admitting to the surgeon were just awesome nurses were fantastic!!

Never takes you seriously, criminals get in before you. I'm judged on my age and conditions, mental health is a joke in Manitoba. I would recommend just staying home and getting into your doctor or walk in clinic because you will be waiting 6 hours before you see a doctor.

Had came in at 1:30 pm for right lower abdomen pain, was diagnosed with appendicitis and Har it removed at 7:30 pm very efficient staff and the most comfortable stay I've had, thank you so much to everyone who was able to help me so quickly
Went for doctors appointment. He wasn't there.

I‚Äôve had an ok stay. I‚Äôm still in a lot of pain... and they didn‚Äôt find out where the infection is coming  from.  All the nurses are really lovely people. And the orderly‚Äôs are really helpful.
Extremely well run ER nurses are hardworking.

Had my father in emergency last night for 7 hours before taking him home he arrived by ambulance only to be taken to the waiting room, I spoke to a nurse very nicely about how much longer it may be as several other patients went ahead that were there shorter time only to get told to calm down I was in no way rude and we had been told for 3 hours he would be next to get a bed, I took him back home struggling to help him walk when is our government going to invest money back to health care this is beyond rediculous

Went to the Grace Hospital for an apt. I parked in their parking lot. Was in the hospital for 2 hrs and it cost me 5 dollars.  Not bad at all as far as hospital parking goes. Easy to navigate my way inside the hospital as well.
By far the rudest, most disrespectful and least compassionate team of medical staff I have been anywhere near in my entire life. Legitimately would rather die than go back there.
I had knee surgery, and the staff was so nice to me. From preoperative to postoperative, I couldn't have better care.

Be careful about this hospital and don‚Äôt go if you can help it ‚Äî they just treated an elderly First Nations patient with outright horrific disrespect and cruelty. The apologies to the poor traumatized patient should be publicly made!! Please let this hospital know this sort of thing is unacceptable in Canada!

Went for blood tests on Monday, July 12th and wait times were unacceptable. It was taking 15 mins or more between patients!!!!
Obviously under-staffed. Patient before me waited over an hr for his blood tests.
Their care for our family as we met the end of our hospitalized parent was so helpful and heart felt. We were given help and privacy with dignity.  Thank you!
I have to say this is the best hospital in Winnipeg the doctors are amazing üòé ‚Ä¶
Had a close family member have an injury here, great staff and understanding people.
Great hospital in all Kind caring staff and security team.Very clean and pleasant feeling environment to get well in.

Waited for 4hrs to get in sprained my knee pretty bad, can‚Äôt walk much hoping to have someone help me but instead waited just to sign me up for crutches. Worst hospital ever. Nurses aren‚Äôt very much helpful either.
Such a beautiful hospital. Very clean and well maintained. My Mom came here to see a vascular specialist and was so happy with how the staff treated her.
Some nice Nurses but not all! The nurse that was on tonight she was super nice and willing to listen and do what ever you need!

Waited 6 hours to be told "take advil or tylenol"
The doctor left didn't even let me speak
Have been to visit people in the hospital. Never been a patient.  Normal hospital.  Parking and bus route. Has a nice gift shop and Tim Hortons shop
The timing is always short. And the service is great. Thank you all so much.

My 84 years old mother just spent a night at the ER with high blood pressure, low in sodium and nausea ,  the place was busy and with no bed, so they left her on a chair in the hallway with saline on, when she asked for help going the bathroom, a nurse was so rude said that she's busy and my mother was selfish only thinking of herself, and consistently talking down on her, my mother had to apologize to her, so unprofessional, I understand people have bad days but take it out on the patients, they are there because they needed help
I was very impressed here. The new addition is very nice and the staff were excellent. They did a thorough job to find out what was wrong with me.
Nurses seemed very understanding and caring.... kept everyone informed of what was going on with our loved one.
Every time I had to spend time there, I found all the staff very friendly, and looked after me very nicely. I have absolutely no complaints.
Had knee surgery.  Doctor Ian Goldstein and the nurses were wonderful
My stay at the Grace hospital was just fine and the food was even good.  Likable  and caring staff.
Truly lacks care and compassion. Nurses texting and kicking patients. Lack of follow through. Horrible experience.
Outstanding hospital. Everyone is so kind caring and Very helpful. But far the best hospital in Winnipeg...
I volunteer once a week.  It's been the best volunteering I have done since retiring.

The wait in the ER is ridiculously long waited 6 in half hours  as did the majority of others for something that would take 10
Minutes at most
A women came in that was going to put a needle in her arm and cause a bubble, they kept her waiting for ages,then sent her to HCS TO GET,RID,OF HER........NO HELP
When you ask at the desk for help once admitted  they sure take their time talking and laughing. I hear others in the background yelling  for assistance.
My son had surgery and a day later they discharged him, with a fever of 102
General Hospital with a 24hr Emergency. Tim Hortons on main floor, Cafe in basement.
Floors are so dirty that large piece of debris wrecked my screen protector in my phone .
Neat environment

Nicest people ever
Love the Grace
They dropped me when i was born
Ok i guess nice nurses careing
Very helpful and short waiting time.
Great facility with caring staff
Super professional/ friendly  doctors & nurses.
Emergency is a joke at this place
ER could be better
